special_features: Animated version of missing Episode 3 in color and black-and-white
Tele-snap reconstruction of Episode 3 as a bonus feature

notes: This story directly follows on from 'The Enemy of the World'.
Only episodes 1, 2, 4, 5 and 6 exist in the BBC Archives, with episode 3 being the only missing episode.
This story acts as a sequel to 'The Abominable Snowmen', which also featured Yeti, the Great Intelligence, and Professor Travers.
The year in which the story takes place is not directly stated, but has been placed in 1966, 1968, 1969 or 1975 by various sources.

continuity_notes: This story introduced the character of Colonel Lethbridge-Stewart, who would later become Brigadier Lethbridge-Stewart and a recurring character in the series.
The events of this story were the catalyst for the creation of UNIT.
The Seventh Doctor later told Ace about the Yeti incursion in the London Underground.
The Great Intelligence and its use of the Yeti would be explored further in subsequent stories.

plot.plot_summary: The TARDIS narrowly avoids becoming engulfed in a cobwebby substance in space. It arrives in the London Underground railway system, the tunnels of which are being overrun by the mysterious web, produced by the Great Intelligence's robot Yeti. The time travellers learn this crisis was precipitated when Professor Travers, whom they first met in the Himalayas some thirty years earlier, accidentally caused one of the Yeti to be reactivated, opening the way for the Intelligence to invade again. The travellers work alongside army forces — led initially by Captain Knight, and then by Colonel Lethbridge-Stewart — as they battle the alien menace, hampered by one of their number under the Intelligence's influence acting as a traitor in their midst.

The Doctor is forced to confront the Great Intelligence directly, as it plans to drain his mind using a special machine. The Doctor is able to thwart the Intelligence's plans, but at the cost of allowing it to escape and continue its machinations.
